item.title: Crust of Rust: Smart Pointers and Interior Mutability
item.author: ccrysisa
item.description: In this fourth Crust of Rust video, we cover smart pointers and interior mutability, by re-implementing the Cell, RefCell, and Rc types from the standard library. As part of that, we cover when those types are useful, how they work, and what the equivalent thread-safe versions of these types are. In the process, we go over some of the finer details of Rust's ownership model, and the UnsafeCell type. We also dive briefly into the Drop Check rabbit hole (https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/nomicon/dropck.html) before coming back up for air.
